result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie S Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stephanie S Nelson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stephanie S Nelson was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by 4:30 p.m. today, July 14, 2015.

miscConds.notes: Must make minimum payments of $65.00 per month commencing September 1, 2015 towards Court costs and financial obligations.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
CORRECTED 7/20/2015 TO INCLUDE $200.00 DNA SURCHARGE.
Must have no contact with Steven W.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must take any prescribed medications as prescribed by physician.

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Stephanie S Nelson in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Defendant Stephanie S Nelson in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 15CM294 AND 15CM159.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court questions defendant.

15CM159: 
Count 1 previously dismissed.
State moves to amend Count 2 to 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a) misdemeanor theft.  Court grants amendment.
Defendant enters Guilty plea to Count 2 as amended.  Court accepts and finds Guilty.

15CM294:
Count 1:  State requests domestic enhancer be removed.  Court grants removal of domestic enhancer and orders Count 1 amended to 947.01 disorderly conduct misdemeanor.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 as amended.  Court accepts and finds Guilty.
Count 2:  Court orders dismissed.

State relates recommendation.  State presents victim impact statement for 15CM159.  
Attorney Olson relates recommendation.

Court relates and orders: Sentence Withheld on both cases.
15CM159 Count 2:
Probation: 1 year.
Restitution: $400.00.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Community Service: 50 hours.
Must have no contact with Steven Williams.
Must take any prescribed medications as prescribed by physician.
Court costs.


15CM294 Count 1:
Probation:  1 year.  Concurrent with 15CM159.
Court Costs.

Court orders $65.00 payment minimum per month beginning September 1, 2015 on court costs and financial obligations.
Must report to Probation by 4:30 p.m. today.

Defendant Stephanie S Nelson in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense' Motion to Dismiss Count 1. Defense makes argument. State makes argument. Court dismisses Count 1. Plea date set for 7/20/15 at 2:00 p.m.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
filed by Attorney Aaron Olson on behalf of Defendant
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Count One

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must have no contact with Steven W.

Defendant Stephanie S Nelson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond (for today).  Defendant Stephanie S Nelson in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea of Not Guilty to all counts.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
